title: K3 Surfaces, the Kuga-Satake Construction, and the DPT Framework (Paper 55, Constructive Reverse Mathematics Series)
description:
Paper 55 of the Constructive Reverse Mathematics series. Second out-of-sample test of the Decidability-Preserving Transfer (DPT) framework, applied to K3 surfaces and the Kuga–Satake construction. Achieves a full decomposition demonstrating the codimension principle.

Key results: (A) Motivated cycle transfer via André (1996). (B) Axiom 2 independence via Deligne Weil I. (C) Kuga–Satake construction provides Axiom 3 through the Clifford algebra and Rosati involution. (D) Supersingular bypass at Picard number ρ = 22. (E) No Picard boundary: decidability does not degrade as ρ varies. (F) Calabi–Yau threefold correction: weight-3 Hodge–Riemann restores positive-definiteness. (G) 7-row comparison table assembling the full calibration verdict.

The Lean 4 / Mathlib formalization comprises 8 source files (1,131 lines), compiles with zero errors, zero warnings, and zero sorry gaps. 9 principled axioms encode deep published results (André 1996, Lieberman 1968, Matsusaka 1957, Deligne 1974, Lawson–Michelsohn 1989, van Geemen 2000, Nygaard–Ogus 1985 / Charles 2013, Lefschetz 1924, Hodge 1941 / Griffiths 1969).

Code is distributed exclusively via this Zenodo record.
notes: AI-assisted formalization using Claude (Anthropic, Opus 4.6) for Lean 4 code generation under human direction.
